snippet: A State Supreme Court justice allowed a lawsuit to move forward that argues that laws protecting bad teachers from dismissal violate children’s rights to a sound education.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Philip G Minardo allows lawsuit challenging constitutionality of teacher tenure laws to move forward, denying motion by city, state and union officials to dismiss case; suit alleges that laws jeopardize quality of education by making it too difficult to fire bad teachers.
lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court justice allowed a lawsuit to move forward that argues that laws protecting bad teachers from dismissal violate children’s rights to a sound education.

headline.main: Staten Island Judge Allows Suit on Teacher Tenure to Proceed
headline.print_headline: S.I. Judge Allows Suit on Tenure to Proceed
